snippet: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton personally delivered the news of Afghanistan’s entry into a club that includes Israel, Japan, Pakistan and other close allies.
abstract: United States declares Afghanistan a major, non-NATO ally, with Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton personally delivering the news of Afghanistan’s entry into a club that includes Israel, Japan, Pakistan and other close Asian and Middle Eastern allies; designation grants a country special privileges, like access to American military training and excess military supplies.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and GRAHAM BOWLEY
byline.contributor: Jane Perlez contributed reporting from Tokyo.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton personally delivered the news of Afghanistan’s entry into a club that includes Israel, Japan, Pakistan and other close allies.
